rim:LocalizedString.value: CIM extension package for Web Registry Service
Provides extensions for managing ISO 19139 metadata in the WRS
Basic extension package for CSW-ebRIM
Provides general extensions that must be recognized by all implementations of the CSW-ebRIM catalogue profile.
This is the canonical ClassificationScheme for pre-defined association types
Associates a User with an Organization.
Associates a User with an employing Organization.
Associates a User with a membership Organization.
Associates a registry object with another registry object related to it in some manner.
Associates a registry Federation with a member Registry.
Associates a RegistryPackage with a member registry object.
Associates an ExternalLink with a target registry object.
Associates an XACML PolicySet with a Policy.
Associates a registry object with some equivalent registry object.
Associates a registry object with some base object that it extends.
Associates a registry object with some antecedent object that it displaces.
Associates a registry object with some other object that it requires for normal usage.
Associates a registry object with some antecedent object that it replaces.
Associates a submitting Organization with some registry object.
Associates an Organization with some registry object that it is responsible for maintaining.
Associates a User with a registry object created by the user.
Associates an Organization with a Service that it offers.
Associates an ExtrinsicObject that stipulates access constraints with the registry object that they apply to.
Defines Event types for AuditableEvent eventType atribute.
Event is a result of an ApproveObjectsRequest.
New registry object created as a result of a SubmitObjectsRequest.
Event is a result of an RemoveObjectsRequest where the scope is DeleteAll.
Event is a result of an DeprecateObjectsRequest.
Event is a result of an getContentRequest.
Event is a result of an RelocateObjectsRequest.
Event is a result of an UndeprecateObjectsRequest.
Event is a result of an UpdateObjectsRequest.
Event is a result of an UpdateObjectsRequest or SubmitObjectsRequest where the original object got versioned.
Defines the types codes a ClassificationNode can have within a ClassificationScheme. Used by the nodeType attribute of ClassificationScheme.
Each node in ClassificationScheme MUST have a unique code assigned to it.
Each node in ClassificationScheme MUST have a unique code assigned to it which MUST embed the path information from root node to that node.
Each node in ClassificationScheme MAY have a code that MAY be used in another node in the ClassificationScheme.
This is the canonical ClassificationScheme for object type hierarchy
General base class [ebRIM, s. 2.5].
Contains a query expressed in a supported query syntax [ebRIM, s. 7.3].
Expresses a relationship between two registry objects [ebRIM, ss. 3.5-3.6].
Constituent of an audit trail that records the change history of a registry object [ebRIM, s. 7.1].
Classifies a registry object by referencing a node in some ClassificationScheme [ebRIM, s. 4.3].
Represents a term in a taxonomy or controlled vocabulary [ebRIM, s. 4.2].
An alternate identifier assigned by an external authority [ebRIM, s. 2.11].
A resolvable reference (URL) to an external resource [ebRIM, s. 2.12].
A notice regarding an event of interest to a subscriber [ebRIM, s. 7.7].
A company, corporation, firm, enterprise or institution that supplies products or services [ebRIM, s. 5.3].
A human being [ebRIM, s. 5.1].
A person who has registered an account in a registry [ebRIM, s. 5.2].
Provides information about a public service endpoint [ebRIM, s. 6.2].
Relates a ServiceBinding to a technical specification for a service [ebRIM, s. 6.3].
Identifies auditable events of interest to a user that may trigger actions such as notification [ebRIM, s. 7.2].
A controlled vocabulary or taxonomy (that may be defined externally) used to classify registry objects [ebRIM, s. 4.1].
A managed set of cooperating registries that may span multiple organizations [ebRIM, s. 8.2].
An ebXML Registry Service (ebRS) implementation [ebRIM, s. 8.1].
A collection of registry objects [ebRIM, s. 2.10].
An online or professional service [ebRIM, s. 6.1].
Provides metadata about some (possibly external) repository item [ebRIM, s. 2.9].
An XACML (OASIS eXtensible Access Control Markup Language) resource.
An XACML policy statement that specifies a set of access control rules.
A set of XACML policies or other policy sets that govern access to a resource.
An XML resource.
An XHTML (Extensible HyperText Markup Language) resource.
An XForms resource containing device-neutral information pertaining to a form.
An XSLT (XSL Transformations) resource.
A W3C XML Schema resource.
Canonical ClassificationScheme for Query Language. Used by QueryExpression.queryLanguage
Defines Status types for RegistryObject status atribute.
The destination state for an ApproveObjectsRequest.
The destination state for a DeprecateObjectsRequest.
The destination state for a SubmitObjectsRequest.
The destination state for a RemoveObjectsRequest where the scope is DeleteRepositoryItemOnly.
Describes what the service does: its features and capabilities (e.g., a capabilities document).
Describes how the service works, including its essential computational characteristics and behaviours (e.g., a WSDL interface description).
Describes how to access the service: the communications protocols and network endpoints (e.g., a WSDL service description).
Description of a geographic data set.
A formal description of a conceptual model, expressed using a textual or graphical schema language (e.g., UML, XMI, XML Schema, RELAX NG, Schematron).
A set of rules for presenting or styling some information resource, typically expressed using a style language (e.g., XSLT, CSS).
A symbolic visual resource other than text (e.g., diagrams, photographs, drawings, maps, animations).
Documentation of any kind (e.g. specifications, manuals, reports, FAQs).
Commentary intended to interpret, explain, or clarify some other resource or part thereof.

Information about the rights held in and over the resource. Typically, a Rights object embodies a rights management statement that stipulates conditions of use or distribution (e.g., ODRL, MPEG-21/REL).
Query syntax defined in the CSW part (Clause 11) of OGC Catalogue Services 2.0 (04-021r3).
Associates a Service with a Dataset.
Associates a Service with a ServiceProfile.
Associates a Service with a ServiceModel.
Associates a Service with a ServiceGrounding.
Associates a source Dataset with an Image that illustrates or summarizes the data (e.g., a browsing aid).
Links a source Annotation to a target registry object that it explains or evaluates.
Associates a source ExternalLink (that refers to an item in an external repository) with a target ExtrinsicObject.
Web Feature Service (WFS)
OGC web service that provides access to and management of a feature store.
Web Mapping Service (WMS)
OGC web service that provides access to a store of geographic graphics, i.e., pictures of geographic data.
Web Coverage Service (WCS)
OGC web service that provides access to and management of a coverage store.
Catalogue services for the Web (CSW)
Provides web-based discovery and metadata management facilities.
CSW-ebRIM catalogue application profile
A profile of the CSW protocol binding based on the OASIS ebXML registry information model (ebRIM).
Web Processing Service (WPS)
OGC web service that provides access to calculations or models which operate on spatially referenced data. The data required by the service can be available locally, or delivered across a network.
ISO 19119 Geographic services taxonomy
This taxonomy (defined in Subclause 8.3) is used to classify services according to their general computational characteristics.
Human interaction services
Services for providing user interfaces, graphics, multimedia, and for presentation of compound documents.
Catalogue viewer
Client service that allows a user to interact with a catalogue to locate, browse, and manage metadata about geographic data or geographic services.
Geographic viewer

Client service that allows a user to view one or more feature collections or coverages. This viewer allows a user to interact with map data, e.g., displaying, overlaying and querying. An example is the viewer client generator defined in ISO 19128.
Geographic spreadsheet viewer
Client service that allows a user to interact with multiple data objects and to request calculations similar to an arithmetic spreadsheet but extended to geographic data.
Service editor

Client service that allows a user to control geographic processing services. Views include understanding a service, composing/scripting service chains, invoking a service, statusing a service, scheduling services, and invoking a service chain.
Workflow enactment manager
Provides user interaction with a workflow enactment service.
Geographic feature editor

Geographic viewer that allows a user to interact with feature data, e.g.,displaying, querying. Supports feature annotation. The user controls view orientation, perspective, depth cueing, hidden-line/surface, light-sources, transparency, and texture etc.
Geographic symbol editor
Client service that allows a human to select and manage symbol libraries. ISO 19117 is relevant to symbol libraries.
Feature generalization editor

Client service that allows a user to modify the cartographic characteristics of a feature or feature collection by simplifying its visualization, while maintaining its salient elements - the spatial equivalent of simplification.
Geographic data-structure viewer

Client service that allows a user to access part of dataset to see its internal structure. Allows user to request creation of new objects from parts of an object being browsed. Allow user to request a check of an object (e.g., type checking).
Model/information management services
Services for managing the development, manipulation, and storage of metadata, conceptual schemas, and datasets.
Feature access service
Provides access to and management of a feature store. An access service may include a query that filters the data returned to the client. ISO 19125-1 is relevant to feature access.
Map access service
Provides access to a geographic graphics (i.e., pictures of geographic data).
Coverage access service
Provides access to and management of a coverage store. An access service may include a query that filters the data returned to the client. ISO 19123 and ISO 19111 are relevant to coverage access.
Coverage Access Service - sensors
Provides access to a coverage where the source of the coverage data is a real-time sensor, i.e., not a persistent store.
Sensor description service
Provides the description of a coverage sensor, including sensor location and orientation, as well as the sensor-s geometric, dynamic, and radiometric characteristics for geoprocessing purposes.
Product access service

Provides access to and management of a geographic product store. A product can be a predefined feature collection and metadata with known boundaries and content, corresponding to a paper map or report.
Feature type service
Provides access to and management of a store of feature type definitions. The static and dynamic information models for a feature type catalogue are provided in ISO 19110.
Catalogue service

Provides discovery and management services on a store of metadata about instances. The metadata may be for dataset instances, e.g., dataset catalogue, or may contain service metadata, e.g., service catalogue.
Registry service

Provides access to store of metadata about types or structured vocabularies that can be organized and related to each other. Example registries are information community registries, type dictionaries, service registries and schema registries.
Gazetteer service
Provides access to a directory of instances of a class or classes of realworld phenomena containing some information regarding position. An information model for a gazetteer is provided by ISO 19112.
Order handling service

Provides the ability to order products from a provider including: formulation of quotes on orders, selection of geographic processing options, submission of an order, statusing of orders, and billing etc.
Standing order service

Order handling service that allows a user to request that a product over a geographic area be disseminated when it becomes available. Such dissemination includes receive, prepare (i.e., reformat, compress, decompress, etc.), prioritize, etc.
Workflow/task management services
Services for supporting specific tasks or work-related activities conducted by humans. These services support use of resources and development of products involving a sequence of activities or steps.
Chain definition service

Enables the definition and execution of a chain by the workflow enactment service. This includes information about its starting and completion conditions, constituent activities and rules for navigating between them, etc.
Workflow enactment service
Interprets a chain and controls the instantiation of services and sequencing of activities. This is done through one or more co-operating workflow management engines, which manages the execution.
Subscription service

Allow clients to register for notification about events of interest. Events are defined by a service that performs an activity resulting in the event. Events are catalogued by the subscription service.
Processing services

Services that perform large-scale computations involving substantial amounts of data. Examples include services for providing the time of day, spelling checkers, and services that perform coordinate transformations.
Spatial processing service
Performs spatial operations on geographic features.
Coordinate transformation service
Transforms or converts coordinates between coordinate reference systems (see ISO 19111).
Orthorectification service
Removes image displacement due to variation in terrain elevation. Orthorectification requires use of digital elevation data, usually in grid form.
Thematic processing service
Performs thematic operations on geographic features.
Thematic classification service
Classifies regions of geographic data based on thematic attributes.
Feature generalization service
Generalizes feature types in a feature collection to increase the effectiveness of communication by counteracting the undesirable effects of data reduction.
Geoparsing service
Scans text resources for location-based references, such as a place names, addresses, postal codes, etc., in preparation for passage to a geocoding service.
Geocoding service
Augments location-based text references with geographic coordinates (or some other spatial reference).
Temporal processing service
Performs temporal operations on geographic features.
Metadata processing service
Performs operations on geographic metadata.
Geographic communication services
Communication services are services for encoding and transfer of data across communications networks.
Encoding service
Provides an implementation of an encoding rule and an interface for encoding and decoding functionality. A standard relevant to encoding is ISO 19118.
Transfer service
Provides an implementation of one or more transfer protocols, which allows data transfer between distributed information systems over off-line or on-line communication media.
Compression service
Converts spatial portions of a feature collection to and from compressed form.
Format conversion service
Converts from one geographic data format to another.
Messaging service
Allows multiple users to simultaneously view, comment about, and request edits of feature collections. This service allows collaboration involving geographic data.
System management services
Services that manage system components, applications, and networks. These services also include the management of user accounts and user access privileges.
Authentication service
Provides authentication information and facilities for verifying an identity claimed by or for a system entity.
Authorization service
Evaluates relevant access control policies and renders access control decisions.
Geographical regions of the world
Régions géographiques du monde
Composition of macro geographical (continental) regions, geographical sub-regions, and selected economic and other groupings.
Composition des régions macrogéographiques (continentales), composantes gépgraphiques des régions et composition de groupements sélectionnés économiques et d'autres groupements.
Eastern Africa
Afrique orientale
Middle Africa
Afrique centrale
Northern Africa
Afrique septentrionale
Southern Africa
Afrique australe
Western Africa
Afrique occidentale
Amériques
Northern America
Amérique du Nord
Latin America and the Caribbean
Amérique latine et Caraïbes
Caraïbes
Central America
Amérique centrale
South America
Amérique du Sud
Central Asia
Asie centrale
Eastern Asia
Asie orientale
Southern Asia
Asie méridionale
South-Eastern Asia
Asie du Sud-Est
Western Asia
Asie occidentale
Eastern Europe
Europe orientale
Northern Europe
Europe septentrionale
Southern Europe
Europe méridionale
Western Europe
Europe occidentale
Océanie
Australia and New Zealand
Australie et Nouvelle-Zélande
Mélanésie
Micronésie
Polynésie
Returns a list of registered services. The optional serviceType parameter is an absolute URI value that identifies a service category of interest (a node in the ISO 19119 services taxonomy).
Returns a list of registered extension packages as a sequence of rim:RegistryPackage elements.

Returns a list of available stored query definitions as a sequence of rim:AdhocQuery elements. The optional id parameter is an absolute URI value that refers to a given stored query; multiple values may be included.
Returns the list of registry objects comprising the version history for the registry object specified by the required id parameter; if multiple values are provided, all but the first one is ignored.
Character Sets
Defines a classification of Character Sets
16-bit fixed size Universal Character Set, based on ISO/IEC 10646
32-bit fixed size Universal Character Set, based on ISO/IEC 10646
7-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646
8-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646
16-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646
16-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646
ISO/IEC 8859-2, Information technology – 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets – Part 2: Latin alphabet No. 2
ISO/IEC 8859-3, Information technology – 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets – Part 3: Latin alphabet No. 3
ISO/IEC 8859-4, Information technology – 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets – Part 4: Latin alphabet No. 4
ISO/IEC 8859-51, Information technology – 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets – Part 5: Latin/Cyrillic alphabet
ISO/IEC 8859-6, Information technology – 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets – Part 6: Latin/Arabic alphabet
ISO/IEC 8859-7, Information technology – 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets – Part 7: Latin/Greek alphabet
ISO/IEC 8859-8, Information technology – 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets – Part 8: Latin/Hebrew alphabet
ISO/IEC8859-9, Information technology – 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets – Part 9: Latin alphabet No. 5
ISO/IEC 8859-10, Information technology – 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets – Part 10: Latin alphabet No. 6
ISO/IEC 8859-11, Information technology – 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets – Part 11: Latin/Thai alphabet
ISO/IEC 8859-13, Information technology – 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets – Part 13: Latin alphabet No. 7
ISO/IEC 8859-14, Information technology – 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets – Part 14: Latin alphabet No. 8 (Celtic)
ISO/IEC 8859-15, Information technology – 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets – Part 15: Latin alphabet No. 9
ISO/IEC 8859-16, Information technology – 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets – Part 16: Latin alphabet No. 10
japanese code set used for electronic transmission
japanese code set used on MS-DOS based machines
japanese code set used on UNIX based machines
united states ASCII code set (ISO 646 US)
ibm mainframe code set
korean code set
traditional Chinese code set used in Taiwan, Hong Kong of China and other areas
simplified Chinese code set
Cited Responsible Party
Defines a classification for CitedResponsibleParty
party who published the resource
party who created the resource
party who authored the resource
party who can be contacted for acquiring knowledge about or acquisition of the resource
ISO 19115 Classification Code
Defines a classification of handling restrictions on the dataset
available for general disclosure
not for general disclosure
available for someone who can be entrusted with information
kept or meant to be kept private, unknown, or hidden from all but a select group of people
of the highest secrecy
ISO 19115 Coupling Types
Defines a classification for types of coupling between service and dataset
loosely coupled data association
service loosely and tightly coupled to different datasets
service tightly coupled to datasets
ISO 19115 DCP List
Defines a classification of DCP (Distributed Computing Platforms)
XML-based Distributed Computing Platform
corba-based Distributed Computing Platform
java-based Distributed Computing Platform
COM-based Distributed Computing Platform
SQL-based Distributed Computing Platform
web service-based Distributed Computing Platform
ISO 19115 Keyword Types
Defines a classification of keyword types
keyword identifies a branch of instruction or specialized learning
keyword identifies a location
keyword identifies the layer(s) of any deposited substance
keyword identifies a time period related to the dataset
keyword identifies a particular subject or topic
ISO 19115 Restriction Codes
Defines a classification of use and access constraints

exclusive right to the publication, production, or sale of the rights to a literary, dramatic, musical, or artistic work, or to the use of a commercial print or label, granted by law for a specified period of time to an author, composer, artist, distributor
government has granted exclusive right to make, sell, use or license an invention or discovery
patent Pending
produced or sold information awaiting a patent
a name, symbol, or other device identifying a product, officially registered and legally restricted to the use of the owner or manufacturer
formal permission to do something
intellectual Property Rights
rights to financial benefit from and control of distribution of non-tangible property that is a result of creativity
withheld from general circulation or disclosure
other Restrictions
limitation not listed
ISO 19115 Restriction Types
Defines a classification for the type of restriction
restriction concerning the access to the resource
restriction concerning the use to the resource
ISO 19115 Spatial Representation Types
Method used to spatially represent geographic information
vector data is used to represent geographic data
grid data is used to represent geographic data
textual or tabular data is used to represent geographic data
triangulated irregular network
three-dimensional view formed by the intersecting homologous rays of an overlapping pair of images
scene from a video recording
ISO 19115 Topic Categories
Defines a classification of application domains to which spatial data are related
rearing of animals and/or cultivation of plants
flora and/or fauna in natural environment
legal land descriptions
processes and phenomena of the atmosphere
economic activities, conditions and employment
height above or below sea level
environmental resources, protection and conservation
information pertaining to earth sciences
health, health services, human ecology, and safety
base maps
military bases, structures, activities
inland water features, drainage systems and their characteristics
positional information and services
features and characteristics of salt water bodies (excluding inland waters)
information used for appropriate actions for future use of the land
characteristics of society and cultures
man-made construction
means and aids for conveying persons and/or goods
energy, water and waste systems and communications infrastructure and services
Format Name and Version
Two-level classification of Format Name and Version to be expanded by a user community
Metadata Standard Name and Version
Two-level classification of Metadata Standard Name and Version to be expanded by a user community
Information resource that is accessible over the Internet and does not fit into the category of services.
Dataset Collection
A collection of datasets sharing the same product specification.
Elementary Dataset
A dataset not having any subset.
Resource Metadata
Metadata about a repository resource.
Data Resource Metadata
Metadata about a repository resource focusing on the data content.
Service Metadata
Metadata about a repository resource focusing Service or Application Interface
Responsible Party
Set of information about the identity of person(s), and/or position, and/or organization(s) associated with the resource
Metadata Information
Metadata related to the record containing the resource metadata.
Legal Constraints
Restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing and using the resource or its metadata.
Security Constraints
Handling restrictions imposed on the resource or metadata for national security or similar security concerns.
Format of the data.
Identified Item
Information about an identified item.
Service Operation
Describes the signature of one and only one method provided by the service.
Cited Item
Information related to a cited item.
Reference Specification
Information related to a reference specification.
Is Client Of
Associates an Application with a set of Service.
Associates an Application with a set of Dataset.
Associates a DatasetCollection with a set of Dataset.
Dataset Description
Associates a description of Data Resource Metadata with a Dataset.
Operates On
Associates the Metadata of a service with the Metadata of the data that the service operates on as input or output.
Service Description
Associates a description of Service Metadata with a Service.
Application Description
Associates a description of a metadata record with an Application.
Resource Metadata Information
Associates a Resource Metadata with its record.
Parent Metadata Information
Provides information on the metadata record to which this metadata record is a subset
Resource Distribution Format
Associates a Resource Metadata with a set of Format.
Resource Reference System
Associates Resource Metadata with a set of IdentifiedItem corresponding to the description of reference systems.
Cited Responsible Party
Name and position information for an individual or organization that is responsible for the resource.
Contains Operation
Provides information about the operations that the service comprises.
Resource Constraints
Provides information about constraints which apply to the resource(s).
Code Space
Provides the identifier of the code space to which an IdentifiedItem pertains.
Provides the CitedItem corresponding to the Authority responsible for the IdentifiedItem.
Provides information about the specification conformance of the metadata.
Provides information about the Name and email address for an organization that is responsible for the metadata resource.
